title: Research
text:
PhD Research, University of Minnesota (Nov 2019 – May 2024)
Graduate Research Assistant
Advisor: Dr. Karunya K. Kandimalla
My dissertation research focused on understanding how amyloid-beta (Aβ) peptides and insulin resistance contribute to cerebrovascular dysfunction in Alzheimer’s disease, with a special emphasis on the blood-brain barrier (BBB). Key accomplishments include:

📊 Developed a population pharmacokinetic model to study Aβ isoform trafficking and accumulation at the BBB endothelium.
Published in Molecular Pharmaceutics
🔬 Conducted flow cytometry, western blot, and confocal imaging to investigate distinct molecular mechanisms of Aβ uptake and intracellular trafficking in BBB endothelial cells.
Published in Molecular Pharmacology
🧠 Established a compartmental PK model to deconvolve plasma kinetics of imaging tracers from dynamic SPECT/CT heart scans.
Published in Journal of Pharmacology and Experimental Therapeutics
🧪 Studied the effect of HDL mimetic peptides and gut microbiome metabolites on Aβ accumulation using dynamic imaging and cellular assays.
Published in Molecular Pharmaceutics




4F effect on Amyloid beta PK



🧬 Interpreted time-series transcriptomics of insulin-exposed BBB endothelial cells and co-authored the manuscript.
Published in NPJ Systems Biology and Applications
🔁 Built a quantitative systems pharmacology (QSP) model to simulate insulin signaling and VCAM1 expression in BBB endothelial cells. Integrated proteomics and transcriptomics to study vascular inflammation in Alzheimer’s disease.
Published in CPT: Pharmacometrics & Systems Pharmacology

title: Research
text:
🧬 Modeling Neurodegenerative Disease Progression
Modeling & Simulation Co-op, Biogen Inc. (Jan – Jun 2023)
Clinical Pharmacology and Pharmacometrics
Supervisor: Dr. Jingxian (JC) Chen

📈 Conducted model-based meta-analysis (MBMA) of MDS-UPDRS data to support early Parkinson’s disease (PD) trial design.
🧮 Built nonlinear mixed-effect models (in NONMEM and Monolix) to describe disease progression and time-to-event outcomes.
📊 Simulated longitudinal endpoint profiles to evaluate study designs and dosing strategies.
🗣️ Presented modeling results and impact to internal project teams and stakeholders.
Presented at ACoP14
🧪 Developed a PK/PD model for antisense oligonucleotide (ASO) therapy in PD and simulated alternate regimens to inform dose optimization.

title: Research
section: 🧪 Imaging Probe Development for Cancer Detection
text:
🧪 Imaging Probe Development for Cancer Detection
Undergraduate Research Assistant, Shanghai Jiao Tong University (Oct 2016 – Jun 2019)
Advisor: Dr. Qingqing Meng

🧫 Designed and synthesized bimodal NIR and PET imaging probes targeting CYP1B1 for early tumor detection.
🔬 Evaluated binding affinity and selectivity in CYP1B1-overexpressing cancer cell lines using flow cytometry and confocal imaging.
🧠 Performed in vivo/ex vivo biodistribution and tumor visualization imaging.
Published in J. Med. Chem. and ChemBioChem.

title: Research
section: 🧪 BBB Drug Delivery for Alzheimer’s Therapy
text:
🧪 BBB Drug Delivery for Alzheimer’s Therapy
Summer Research Intern, University of Tokyo / iCONM (Summer 2018)
Supervisor: Dr. Kazunori Kataoka

🧪 Prepared PEGylated anti-Aβ antibodies and characterized them with GPC and DLS.
🧠 Assessed brain delivery and pharmacokinetics of modified antibodies to improve BBB penetration in Alzheimer’s disease.

title: Zengtao Wang
text:
Hi there! My name is Zengtao Wang and I am a pharmacometrician working at Eli Lilly and Company. I am a PKPD scientist by training and I am passionate about applying quantitative modeling and simulation to drug development.


University of Minnesota, Twin Cities | Minneapolis, MN
PhD in Pharmaceutics | Sept 2019 - June 2024
Shanghai Jiao Tong University | Shanghai, China
B.S in Pharmacy | Sept 2015 - June 2019



Eli Lilly and Company | Indianapolis, IN
Advisor - Pharmacometrician | June 2024 - present

title: Personal Life
text:
Where it all began—surrounded by mountains and river valleys. 




A young teenager stepping into a bustling city full of possibilities.




Diving into science and shaping dreams.




A proud moment marking my first contribution to science.




A leap of faith and a heart full of hope.





Turning knowledge into real-world impact.





Years of hard work paid off—hello Dr. Me!





Building a future together, full of love and shared dreams.

title: Personal Life
text:
👋 About Me Outside the Lab
When I’m not modeling pharmacokinetics or optimizing drug development pipelines, I enjoy a variety of activities that help me stay grounded, creative, and connected.

title: Personal Life
text:
🌱 Hobbies & Interests

Gardening — I find peace and joy in growing herbs and vegetables, especially during spring and summer. Watching something grow over time reminds me of both science and patience.
Cooking — Experimenting with new recipes is one of my favorite creative outlets. I enjoy cooking traditional Chinese dishes and trying global cuisines.
Table Tennis & Badminton — Great ways to stay active and have fun with friends and family.
Mahjong — I love playing mahjong with friends — it’s strategic, social, and always entertaining.

title: Personal Life
text:
🌄 Travel & Nature
I’ve had the pleasure of visiting several breathtaking places, including:

🏜️ Death Valley National Park 
🏝 Shenandoah national park 
🏞️ Yellowstone National Park 
🏔️ Grand Teton National Park 
🍁 Banff National Park 
🏞 Yunnan, China 

I love spending time in nature — hiking, exploring, and soaking in the peace of the outdoors.

title: Personal Life
text:
💍 Married Life
I am going to marry my wonderful partner, Lu, in June 2025! ❤️
She’s been an incredible source of support and joy in my life. We’re excited to begin this new chapter together and are grateful for all the love from family and friends.

title: Personal Life
text:
🏠 Life in Indiana
I currently live in the Greater Indianapolis area, where Lu and I recently bought our first home 🏡. It’s been a wonderful journey turning a house into a home, and we’re excited for what the future holds here.

title: Personal Life
text:
👨‍👩‍👧‍👧 Family
I come from a loving family with two amazing older sisters. We remain very close, even as our lives have taken us to different parts of the world.


Thanks for stopping by and getting to know me beyond the publications and projects!
